TopicTitle: KSP-Z49 Advanced Control System (Custom built controller)

Articles.Content:
Here's my attempt at a pretty compact controller for KSP. Might not be as impressive the rest I've seen, but I did enjoy the process (for the most part... now I know why LED's should be kept to a minimum. So much wiring!)

All in all took just under a month to plan, build and test this thing. I've always wanted to atempt to build something like this, and after finding an keyboard just collecting dust I was curious as to whether I could give it a new life!

Here's the imgur album if you want to see some of the pictures of the process. I've also included high quality PNG files of the manufacturing company logos at the end if you're interested. They were created as part of the logo competition, but I never got around to sharing them!

Cool one. I have been partial to scavenging keyboards for controllers for the ease of programming afterwards. But how do you use toggles with the keyboard chip, given that you don't break the connection?

Cool one. I have been partial to scavenging keyboards for controllers for the ease of programming afterwards. But how do you use toggles with the keyboard chip, given that you don't break the connection?

That's the first thing that crossed my mind just before starting. First thing I did was figure out which key presses worked together (before ripping it apart had a look at this keyboard ghosting tool). As I'm not desigining for all the shortcuts I just decided which ones worked well together.

Most of the keyboards I had lying around didn't have the combination I was looking for, but luckily I've somehow managed to horde quite a few over the years. After deciding on the keyboard I had to map out the connections and double check the combinations. There was also a backup plan too... have the connection wired only one way, with the LED on both (so mimic a momentary then throw the switch the oppisite way to 'mark' it).
